Below are some projects that are hosted on [my GitHub](https://github.com/lawalter). These featured repositories showcase my past and present use of different programming languages and frameworks. I regularly work in R and I have experience with R Shiny, R Markdown, Quarto, and creating R packages. Moving forward, I am excited to pick up Julia and try out the Genie framework. 

The GitHub icon {{< fa brands github title = "Example GitHub icon" >}} in each card links to the project repository.

<p class="card-text">I created the [gardenhelpr](https://github.com/lawalter/gardenhelpr) R Shiny app to assist in backyard garden planning. The app generates an interactive visualization of companion and antagonist plants from the user's input. A full list of friends and foes can be downloaded as a csv.</p>

<div class="card bg-light mb-3">
  <div class="card-header">Colorband Combination Generator</div>
  <div class="card-body">
  ![](images/app_img_m.png){fig-alt="Screenshot of Colorband Combination desktop app" fig-align="center"}

<span class="badge rounded-pill bg-success">Complete</span> <span class="badge rounded-pill bg-secondary">2020</span> [{{< fa brands github title = "GitHub link to Colorband Combination Generator repository >}}](https://github.com/lawalter/colorband-app) 

<p class="card-text">The [Colorband Combination Generator](https://github.com/lawalter/colorband-app) app was created with R Shiny and packaged with Electron. It creates random color combinations for bird banding. Colors can be selected based on what's available in a banding kit, and selections are saved for future use via [shinyStore](https://github.com/trestletech/shinyStore).</p>

<p class="card-text">`#R` `#RShiny`</p>

</div>
